Adventure.API
Interface GameLocation

All Superinterfaces:
GameObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
Location
public interface GameLocation
extends GameObject

This interface is used to represent any location within the game world that the Player can explore.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Firmy

Method Summary

          This getter method is used to retrieve a single GameActor by name from this locations list of actors.

Method Detail

showName

void showName()
This method is used to output to the screen the name of this GameLocation.

items

java.util.ArrayList<GameItem> items()
This getter method is used to get the list of items that are in this location.

Returns:
The ArrayList of GameItems in this GameLocation.

item

GameItem item(java.lang.String itemName)
This getter method is used to retrieve a single GameItem by name from this locations list of items.

Parameters:
itemName - The String name of the item to retrieve.
Returns:
The GameItem with the specified name or null if it is not found.

hasItem

boolean hasItem(java.lang.String itemName)
This method is used to determine if the GameItem with the specified name is present in this locations item list.

Parameters:
itemName - The String name of the item to look for.
Returns:
True if the item is present, false otherwise.

actors

java.util.ArrayList<GameActor> actors()
This getter method is used to get the list of actors that are in this location.

Returns:
The ArrayList of GameActors in this GameLocation.

actor

GameActor actor(java.lang.String actorName)
This getter method is used to retrieve a single GameActor by name from this locations list of actors.

Parameters:
actorName - The String name of the item to retrieve.
Returns:
The GameActor with the specified name or null if it is not found.

exit

GameLocation exit(java.lang.String direction)
This getter method is used to get the location that this location exits to in the direction that is specified.

Parameters:
direction - The String direction to get the exit location for.
Returns:
The GameLocation that is the exit for the specified direction, or null if none is found.

hasExit

boolean hasExit(java.lang.String direction)
This method is used to check whether there is an exit in the specified direction. This overload will call the hasExit(String, boolean) overload with a default value of false so that hidden exits are not included.

Parameters:
direction - The String direction to check for an exit.
Returns:
True if an exit is found in the specified direction, false otherwise.

hasExit

boolean hasExit(java.lang.String direction,
                boolean includeHidden)
This method is used to check whether there is an exit in the specified direction. Optionally, hidden exits can also be included in the check.

Parameters:
direction - The String direction to check for an exit.
includeHidden - Whether you wish to include hidden exits in the check.
Returns:
True if an exit is found in the specified direction, false otherwise.

addExit

void addExit(java.lang.String direction,
             GameLocation exitTo)
This setter method is used to add a new exit to this location. This overload will call the addExit(String,GameLocation,boolean) overload with a default of false so that this exit is not hidden

Parameters:
direction - The string direction that this exit is located.
exitTo - The GameLocation that this exit leads to.

addExit

void addExit(java.lang.String direction,
             GameLocation exitTo,
             boolean hideExit)
This setter method is used to add a new exit to this location. You can also mark the exit as hidden or not hidden as well.

Parameters:
direction - The string direction that this exit is located.
exitTo - The GameLocation that this exit leads to.
hideExit - Whether to mark this exit as hidden or not.

removeExit

void removeExit(java.lang.String direction)
This method is used to remove the exit that is in the specified direction from this location.

Parameters:
direction - The String direction to remove the exit from.

revealExits

void revealExits()
This method will mark all exits in this location that are hidden as not hidden.

listActors

java.lang.String listActors()
This method is used to create a String listing of GameActors in this location to the be output.

Returns:
The String list of GameActors

listExits

java.lang.String listExits()
This method is used to create a String listing of exits in this location to the be output.

Returns:
The String list of exits.

listItems

java.lang.String listItems()
This method is used to create a String listing of GameItems in this location to the be output.

Returns:
The String list of GameItems
